qas.question: What defines a new type of USB port, called the charging port?

answers.text: The USB Battery Charging Specification Revision 1.1

qas.question: When was the USB Battery Charging Specification Revision 1.1 released?
What was the USB Battery Charging Specification Revision 1.1 called?
What does a charging port supply?

context: <a0_0>The USB Battery Charging Specification Revision 1.1<a0_0/> (released <a1_0>in 2007<a1_0/>) defines a new type of USB port, called <a2_0>the charging port<a2_0/>. Contrary to the standard downstream port, for which current draw by a connected portable device can exceed 100 mA only after digital negotiation with the host or hub, a charging port can supply currents between 500 mA and 1.5 A without the digital negotiation. A charging port supplies <a3_0>up to 500 mA at 5 V<a3_0/>, up to the rated current at 3.6 V or more, and drops its output voltage if the portable device attempts to draw more than the rated current. The charger port may shut down if the load is too high.
